metadata.Title: CVE-2021-43566 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.Description:
All versions of Samba prior to 4.13.16 are vulnerable to a malicious clientusing an SMB1 or NFS race to allow a directory to be created in an area ofthe server file system not exported under the share definition. Note thatSMB1 has to be enabled, or the share also available via NFS in order forthis attack to succeed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
python3-samba - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
ldb-tools - 2:2.5.2+samba4.16.4-2ubuntu1
libldb2 - 2:2.5.2+samba4.16.4-2ubuntu1
python3-ldb - 2:2.5.2+samba4.16.4-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1').
samba package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1').
